clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy and Safety of Qizhitongluo Capsule in the Recovery Phase of Ischemic Stroke
clinical_study.official_title: Efficacy and Safety of Qizhitongluo Capsule in the Recovery Phase of Ischemic Stroke With Qi Deficiency and Blood Stasis Syndrome: a Multicenter, Randomized,Double-blind，Placebo- and Active-controlled Adaptive Study

lead_sponsor.agency: China Academy of Chinese Medical Sciences

clinical_study.source: China Academy of Chinese Medical Sciences

brief_summary.textblock: This is a 20-week study consisting of a 12-week multicenter, randomized,double-blind adaptive study to compare efficacy and safety of Qizhitongluo Capsule,Naoxintong Capsule and placebo in the recovery phase of ischemic stroke with qi deficiency and blood stasis syndrome, and a 8-week post-treatment safety follow-up.After 312 patients complete 12 weeks of treatment there will be an interim analysis.

arm_group.description: Basic treatment：Aspirin Enteric-coated Tablets was administered orally at a dosage of 100mg/d once per night;the routine recovery training. intervention treatment:the Capsules were administered orally, four capsules each time, three times a day after each meal（placebo was taken only after lunch, and Qizhitongluo Capsule was taken after breakfast and supper)for 12 weeks.

Basic treatment：Aspirin Enteric-coated Tablets was administered orally at a dosage of 100mg/d once per night; the routine recovery training. intervention treatment:Naoxintong Capsule was administered orally, four capsules each time, three times a day after each meal for 12 weeks.

Basic treatment：Aspirin Enteric-coated Tablets was administered orally at a dosage of 100mg/d once per night and the routine recovery training. intervention treatment:placebo capsule was administered orally four capsules each time, three times a day after each meal for 12 weeks.
